trans-unit.source: Deploying Applications to Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Deploying Applications to Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn how to Deploy applications to App Service work
trans-unit.target: Learn how to Deploy applications to App Service work

trans-unit.source: Azure App Service provides a rich and integrated feature set to support creating powerful and flexible deployment workflows.
trans-unit.target: Azure App Service provides a rich and integrated feature set to support creating powerful and flexible deployment workflows.

trans-unit.source: App deployment can leverage options including continuous integration or local source control publishing, WebDeploy, and FTP.
trans-unit.target: App deployment can leverage options including continuous integration or local source control publishing, WebDeploy, and FTP.

trans-unit.source: The recommended method for production app deployment is deployment slot swap.
trans-unit.target: The recommended method for production app deployment is deployment slot swap.

trans-unit.source: Deployment slots represent staging and integration environments associated with production apps.
trans-unit.target: Deployment slots represent staging and integration environments associated with production apps.

trans-unit.source: Deployment slots can be configured and targeted with web traffic for validation, and traffic can be swapped on demand for deployment to production with no down time and automated warm-up.
trans-unit.target: Deployment slots can be configured and targeted with web traffic for validation, and traffic can be swapped on demand for deployment to production with no down time and automated warm-up.

trans-unit.source: The steps of a deployment workflow can be easily automated via release management products such as Visual Studio Release Management.
trans-unit.target: The steps of a deployment workflow can be easily automated via release management products such as Visual Studio Release Management.

trans-unit.source: This is useful for coordination with other solution resources (e.g. data store), recurrence, and replication across multiple units of deployment.
trans-unit.target: This is useful for coordination with other solution resources (e.g. data store), recurrence, and replication across multiple units of deployment.
